ai-iti112:0.3_0: The Chapter on the Holy Offering of the Teaching
ai-iti112:1.1_0: For this was said by the Buddha, the Perfected One: that is what I heard.
ai-iti112:2.1_0: “Mendicants, the world has been understood by the Realized One;
ai-iti112:2.2_0: the Realized One is detached from the world.
ai-iti112:2.3_0: The origin of the world has been understood by the Realized One;
ai-iti112:2.4_0: The origin of the world has been given up by the Realized One.
ai-iti112:2.5_0: The cessation of the world has been understood by the Realized One;
ai-iti112:2.6_0: The Realized One has realized the cessation of the world.
ai-iti112:2.7_0: The practice that leads to the cessation of the world has been understood by the Realized One;
ai-iti112:2.8_0: The practice that leads to the cessation of the world has developed and cultivated.
ai-iti112:3.1_0: In this world—with its gods, Māras, and Brahmās, this population with its ascetics and brahmins, its gods and humans—whatever is seen, heard, thought, known, sought, and explored by the mind, all that has been understood by the Realized One.
ai-iti112:3.2_0: That’s why a Realized One is said to be ‘a Realized One’.
ai-iti112:4.1_0: From the night when the Realized One understands the supreme perfect awakening until the night he becomes fully extinguished—through the natural principle of extinguishment, without anything left over—everything he speaks, says, and expresses is real, not otherwise.
ai-iti112:4.2_0: That’s why a Realized One is said to be ‘a Realized One’.
ai-iti112:5.1_0: The Realized One does as he says, and says as he does.
ai-iti112:5.3_0: That’s why a Realized One is said to be ‘a Realized One’.
ai-iti112:6.1_0: In this world—with its gods, Māras and Brahmās, this population with its ascetics and brahmins, gods and humans—the Realized One is the undefeated, the champion, the universal seer, the wielder of power.
ai-iti112:6.2_0: That’s why he’s called the ‘Realized One’.”
ai-iti112:7.1_0: “Directly knowing the whole world as it is,
ai-iti112:7.2_0: the whole world in its prime,
ai-iti112:7.3_0: he is detached from the whole world,
ai-iti112:7.4_0: without needing anything in the whole world.
ai-iti112:8.1_0: that wise one, purged of all,
ai-iti112:9.1_0: The Buddha has ended all defilements,
ai-iti112:9.3_0: He has attained the end of all deeds,
ai-iti112:9.4_0: freed with the ending of attachments.
ai-iti112:10.3_0: But in all the world with its gods,
ai-iti112:12.4_0: And the boat is the finest thing.
ai-iti112:13.1_0: And so the deities revere the one,
ai-iti112:13.2_0: great of heart and rid of naivety.
ai-iti112:14.1_0: That is what the Buddha has heard.
ai-iti112:14.3_0: The Book of the Fours is finished.
ai-iti112:15.1_0: Brahmin, you know the path of brahmins
ai-iti112:16.2_0: Two on Bhat as a matchmaker
ai-iti112:17.3_0: For a long time, perfected ones live,
ai-iti112:17.4_0: But they don’t call him a ‘flower’.
ai-iti112:17.5_0: The Book of the Ones is finished.
